data.name: 'lil Butler Blue
data.description: Our 5th Double Berliner weiss with bluberries, kettle soured.

style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)
style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.

breweries.name: Hop Farm Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Hop Farm Brewing Company is dedicated to the responsible use of our natural resources, from production to packaging and everywhere in between. We grow our own hops, by hand, organically and add them to every batch we brew. 

The inspiration for Hop Farm Brewing Company began over a decade ago. A green thumb naturally led to growing some of our own hops. The passions of growing hops and making beer came together when Hop Farm Brewing Company opened its doors in September of 2013 at 5601 Butler Street in Pittsburgh's Lawrenceville neighborhood. 

The tap list is ever changing and growing based on seasons so stop by soon and see what beers our staff have crafted for you!

data.name: 100% Lacto Berliner Weisse
data.description: Brewed solely with Lactobacillus and exclusive to the Rare Beer Fest, this refreshing wheat beer has notes of pear, apple, and white wine fruitiness that finishes dry and mildly tart.

data.name: 1895 Barleyweiss
data.description: An all barley-malt Berliner-style weiss based on a historical brewing recipe from the pre-prohibition Frank Sandkuler Brewery, last brewed in Baltimore in 1895. Our recipe takes german Pilsner, Vienna and Acidulated malts and allows them to undergo a 24 lactic fermentation to produce this pale ale that is light, tart and incredibly refreshing.

breweries.name: Union Craft Brewing Company
breweries.description: Union Craft Brewing is a homegrown, independent craft brewery located in the Clipper Mill area of Woodberry. We are dedicated to providing the good people of Baltimore fresh, handcrafted, and approachable beers and to fostering the community that forms whenever great beer is flowing.

breweries.name: Black Market Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Black Market produces high-quality, handcrafted beer.

HUMBLE BEGINNINGS. ALWAYS GREAT BEER.
A small budget, tight resources, and big goals are what Our first brews were made out of at a small warehouse that was, more realistically, a large garage. On that small 1 bbl brewing system we pinned our dreams and created the much-loved Hefeweizen.

FINEST QUALITY INGREDIENTS, FRESHEST QUALITY RESULTS
With big dreams for a mircobrewery, Black Market opened to put Temecula, California on the map with a commitment to use only the best malt, hops and yeast­, all selected by hand to ensure quality.  The results were award-winning products with a reputation for craft excellence.

GREAT BEER FROM WINE COUNTRY
As one of Temecula’s first craft breweries, Black Market introduced locally brewed beers to the community. Now found far beyond Temecula, Black Market beers are on shelves and in establishments throughout Southern California, Arizona and Washington.

LEADING A MOVEMENT
Like many craft breweries before us, we have followed stories of those who came before us. We’re proud to have launched the movement in Temecula, to keep inspiring the next waves of great beer with our success, and to continue to lead through our quality process, experimental hop releases, and innovative beers.

breweries.name: Angry Chair Brewing
breweries.description:
The ultimate plan at Angry Chair Brewing is to brew beers that we like to drink. Right now we like to drink more sessionable styles: hoppy pale ales, Berliner weisses, low ABV saison, and other easy-drinkers. We plan to lean on these styles for our core beers. However, one thing we absolutely believe to be true is that the public will be choosing our “core” beers for us: if you like the beer, we will keep brewing it.
We’re going to have an extensive barrel-aged program as well, especially for sour beers.

We definitely hate being boring and doing boring stuff so you can look forward to experimentation and unique projects.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: A Beer Named Sue
data.description: This beer is dedicated to Sue Muntner, a wonderful friend and supporter of craft beer in Tampa Bay. We made this beer in a style she championed and loaded it with Prickly Pear. Please enjoy this Florida Weisse in a snifter, the only appropriate glassware for toasting Sue.

breweries.name: Cigar City Brewing
breweries.description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

breweries.name: 7venth Sun Brewing

breweries.name: Cycle Brewing
breweries.description: The beer-making innovations of Doug Dozark at Peg's Cantina have inspired a new venture - Cycle Brewing. Doug, with the assistance of brew team Eric Trinosky and Kristina Kirk, have plans to take the brews he made famous at Peg's to St Pete and beyond.

breweries.name: Amstel Brewery
breweries.description: The brewery was founded on June 11, 1870 in Amsterdam and named after the Amstel River, the waters of which also served for refrigeration. By 1872, Amstel was annually producing 10,000 hectoliters. For the purpose of storing the beer, winter ice from canals was kept in special double-walled cellars. Originally, the beer was mostly drank in Amsterdam. From 1883, it was also exported to Great Britain and Indonesia.

breweries.name: Oliphant Brewing
breweries.description:
we're pretty sure that the beer made was part ectoplasmic mud intended as a 5th dimensional chrysalis for an almost immediate and rude awakening of shrimp-kind. once fed to the prawny bastards they grow strong and stout. they're tenuous ligament connections calcify and grow stronger and they can appear to read people's minds by a simple flexing of their delicious muscles. they're tv antenna antennas probe the air and gently wave in the breeze though the touch them is as touching rough-grit sand and glass paper and leaves tiny shards similar grabbing the white paint of a fire hydrant marker. 

we had no idea. we swear. 

we're just here's to brew beer, not help with the awakening of the earth's 6th cycle of developed beings. that being said -- all hail the prawn people! may their mighty and lesser claws be bound only by their own strength of will. let the buddha shrimp click and clackle their obscene language to the world.

data.name: Apricot Berliner Weisse
data.description: A future Ibex Series Release,  Schlafly Apricot Berliner Weisse (or Weiβe) is a cloudy, sour wheat beer from Northern Germany dating back to the 16th Century.  It is 4% abv and 5 IBU’s.  The beer is fermented with our house, “Cosmic Debris” culture of brettanomyces and lactobacillus.  In this version we move beyond the traditional base beer and add over two pounds of apricot puree to the fermentation showcasing the fruit with a nice sharp acidity and Brett character.

breweries.name: The Saint Louis Brewery (Schlafly)
breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

data.name: Apricot Weiss
data.description: You may be asking yourself why there is a flower on the label of an apricot beer. Well, a tree must blossom in order to fruit. Conversely, this beer blossoms after it is fruited. Juicy, tangy and oh-so perfect, no matter the season.

breweries.name: Highland Brewing Company
breweries.description: Highland Brewing Company began in the basement of Barley's Taproom in downtown Asheville, North Carolina in 1994. Through the years the company has grown from a three person operation to a staff of almost 50, from about 4,000 to 35,000 square feet, and from a capacity to brew 2,000 barrels annually to almost 40,000. Those of you who saw the old brewery may remember the retrofitted dairy equipment we used. We held on to two of those tanks in our move to the East Asheville location. Alongside them, we have new fermentation and brite beer tanks to go with our 50-barrel brew house. Our pilot brew house is a brewer's playground for developing new seasonal beers, high gravity brews, and whatever else the brewers dream up. Highland currently supplies both Carolinas, Georgia, Tennessee, Florida, Alabama, Ohio, Kentucky and Virginia. Thanks for your support!

data.name: Athena
data.description: A refreshing, gently tart, German-style wheat beer.  Our take on the classic Berliner has a blend of citric and fruit notes with nods to cider and sauvignon blanc. We go through two fermentations with this beer to offer an interesting complexity in an amazingly light and drinkable beer. Athena is a tribute to our home that shares a name with the greek embodiment of wisdom and curiosity. Given our affinity to the peculiar and curious, we think Athena is a perfect ambassador for the Classic City.

breweries.name: Creature Comforts Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Creature Comforts was founded by people passionate for starting a craft brewery in Athens, GA, a town that we love and that has the potential to be a craft beer hub and destination for the South East.  The first piece of the puzzle was David Stein who at the time was the head brewer at Twain's Billiards & Tap, a well-known brewpub in Decatur, GA.   David was a home brewer turned pro, whose passion for craft beer had moved him through working at some of the top craft beer establishments.  David was using the name Creature Comforts for his personal home brews and that name became the foundation for the brewery we run today.  David quickly brought on his friend Adam Beauchamp, who was in his seventh year of brewing beer at Sweetwater Brewing Company in Atlanta, GA, a brewery he began working at after leaving a PHD in Genetics program at Emory.  Adam himself was an accomplished home-brewer and he had a wealth of experience running a production brewery.                   

With the help of a craft beer enthusiast and local Athens, GA businessman, Derek Imes, we began building Creature Comforts in a beautiful 13,000 square foot historic warehouse building in downtown Athens.  The building was originally built in the 1940's as a Chevy dealership and later became Snow Tire Co., before Creature Comforts took over.  Building in a 1940's warehouse presented a lot of challenges as well as many wonderful opportunities.  One such opportunity was the chance to salvage and reclaim the old wood from the building that was subsequently refinished and then put back into the brewery in the form of bar tops, tables, wall paneling, and ceilings.  The final result, is a brewery that has won an award for outstanding rehabilitation by the Athens Heritage Foundation and something that we are extremely proud to share with the world.

Approximately two months before opening, we found the final missing piece.  We knew we wanted to bring someone into the family who would handle the business aspects of the brewery, considering the fact that Adam and David are brewers dedicated to spending every minute of their day making the best possible beer.  Through a long journey that ended with a very serendipitous introduction that came via a person in Vancouver, British Columbia, Chris Herron, a Georgia native himself who was living in Connecticut, became the CEO of Creature Comforts.  Chris had spent 12 years working in sales, pricing, and finance for major beverage alcohol suppliers, and was intent on starting a craft brewery in Georgia, which made him joining Creature Comforts an easy choice.   We have since added, Blake Tyers a veteran and forward thinking home brewer as a brewer at Creature Comforts, and we brought on Katie Beauchamp to manage our office activities, tours and special events.  Combined with the nearly 20 part time tour staff we have, our entire family is together and we have  20+ years of experience.

What started out as curious exploration of what we love, turned into us uncovering our passion, following that passion, and finding happiness, which has allowed us to enjoy the Creature Comforts of life.   Creature Comforts Brewing Company is truly our very own creature comfort.  Our brewery is what makes us happy, it is what makes us feel at home, it is what comforts us, and puts us in a happy place.  Creature Comforts is the end result of the story of our past and the starting point for the story our future, and we look forward to writing that story with you.

breweries.name: Lineage Brewing
breweries.description: Lineage Brewing® was founded with a simple purpose: create a welcoming social atmosphere where friends can gather and learn about high-quality beer. Like many great discoveries, it was founded in neighborhood Clintonville garages, where homebrew flowed and hops grew up backyard trellises. When creativity, aspirations, and equipment got a little too large for our tiny garages the inevitable craft brewery was born. We continue to be grounded in family, friends, beer education, and the quest for the ever perfect pint. We focus on the range of flavors beer can provide, and offer an ever-changing variety of styles in our brewpub. We hope you enjoy the inquisitive and explorative approach to brewing that Lineage Brewing brings to the Columbus beer scene. And in doing so, we hope that you try something unlike anything you’ve had before.

breweries.name: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Kamala Brewing at the Whip In
breweries.description:
We’ve been retailing here since 1986, the Topiwala family with mom and pop and three brothers as well as the help of a handful of invaluable staff members. Pop started in the recession years of Reaganomics, thru the boom of Clintonia and still strong despite George II & the current class wars. Starting as a convenience store & gas station, we’ve been evolving from pretty much day one, trying to offer quality and service like our friendly Travis Heights neighbors and fellow Austinites deserve.

We are committed to sustainable, local, and organic & natural produce and groceries with our offerings on the shelf as well as our kitchen menu (No high fructose corn syrup or MSG!!!) With 72 taps of beer available, we are quite picky on what we present with only quality brews that go with our food.

We also enjoy giving back to the community with nonprofit fundraisers and support for grassroots organizations.

We serve our very own authentic and unique Gujarati-style Indian food, mom approved.

Beer by the pint & wine by the glass make it that much more of a yummy pairing.

Our own brews are specifically designed for our menu items!

Also enjoy live music in our unique intimate and awesome music room, or at least our staff selections of eclectic tunes.

data.name: B. Weisse
data.description: B.Weisse, or Berliner Weisse is a sour, German wheat beer perfect for the summer. B.Weisse is made with a blend of white & red wheat that takes up 50% of the grain bill and is fermented with a blend of house yeast and lactobacillus. The Lacto gives this wheat beers its tart and acidic refreshing qualities, where the wheat malt lends the round malt body. Hints of pineapple and lemon abound in the effervescence of the nose. The refreshing flavor of this beer makes it the best option for a warm day!

breweries.description: Here at Tap It Brewing Company, located in SLO Town, USA in the heart of the Central Coast, we’re true to our roots and true to our word. We like to take a laid-back approach to almost everything we do. But there’s one thing we’re absolutely serious about – our beer.

breweries.name: Left Coast Brewing
breweries.description:
Left Coast Brewing Company was formed in 2004 with a capacity of 5,500 bbls.  Since then, we have expanded our operation to 13,000 bbls with our current tanks.  Our main focus for the Left Coast are Hoppy Beers, Stouts, and German Lagers. We do however add new styles as part of our seasonal program and have one Belgian tripel ale.

We brew, bottle and keg everything in house at our San Clemente facility and our team is dedicated to the perfection of our product.

breweries.name: Cismontane Brewing
breweries.description:
Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.

The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.

The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.

(cis-mon-tane)

“This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.

data.name: Bärchen
data.description: A faithful Berliner-style Weisse brewed in the new bohemia of Biddeford, Maine. Sitting at 2.9%, the "Little Bear" is short in stature with an aggressive bite. Pleasantly tart, light, and refreshing, Bärchen was brewed using German Heidelberg malt, domestic wheat, Hersbrucker hops, and lactobacillus.

breweries.name: Scarlet Lane Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Scarlet Lane Brewing Company’s mission is to be your humble brewer promoting knowledge and continued betterment in the art of beer making. We will have fun while being excellent stewards to the community, the environment and our employees. 

Beer Cultivates Wisdom and Friendships

breweries.name: Brewery Vivant
breweries.description:
Brewery Vivant is the realization of years of dreaming and much discussion of what a great brewery can be. What makes our brewery different from the rest is the way we approach our craft and operate our business. The core of Brewery Vivant can be found at the crossroads of three passions:

1. Our love of the tradition and artistic approach of the Belgian & French styles of beers

2. Devotion to using local sources for ingredients and running our business according to the three pillars of sustainability; Environmental Integrity, Social Equity, and Economic Viability

3. Sharing the experience of how beer and food can be paired to uplift the enjoyment of both

data.name: Barreliner Weisse
data.description: A slightly different take on Berliner Weisse. This one gets its funk from barrel aging.

breweries.name: Freetail Brewing Company
breweries.description:
#1 rated brewpub in Texas (rated by BeerAdvocate.com) located at NW Military Highway and Loop 1604. Winner of the San Antonio Express-News 2009 Critics Choice and 2010 Silver Medalist for "Best Place for a Cold Beer" & San Antonio Magazine's Best of the City "Best Place for a Beer" for two years running (2009, 2010).  Winner of Draft Magazine "Top 25 Beers of 2010" in the smoked beer category for "Rubio Fumando".

Named after the official Texas flying mammal, the Mexican Free-tail Bat, Freetail opened its doors Thanksgiving Weekend 2008 and has been cranking out highly rated, fresh, off-the-wall brews ever since.

We feature fresh craft brews from in house and around the state of Texas in addition to artisan pizzas, sandwiches, salads, appetizers and desserts made from the highest quality ingredients.

Join the friendliest staff in town for happy hour M 4-7 andW-F 3-7 with $5 apps and $1 off beer and wine!  Or try us on Tuesdays for Pint Night where Freetail pints are $2.50 all day, or Mondays for $10 pitchers.  Enjoy Freetail brews and guest beer from microbreweries around the state in our spacious open seating, or large outdoor patio with bar service, and catch the game on one of our nine high-definition TV's and two 100"+ screens.free_wi_fi_spot_copy.gif  Free WiFi for customers.

data.name: Batch #10 Berliner Weisse - Brown Bag Series
data.nameDisplay: Batch #10 Berliner Weisse - Brown Bag Series
data.description:
Our Brown Bag Series Berliner Weisse is a tart, fruity, highly effervescent and refreshing ale. Relatively low in alcohol at only 3.4%, this highly sessionable brew has a light body and a very dry finish. 

A regional specialty of Berlin, it was referred to by Napoleon's troops in 1809 as "the Champagne of the north" due to its lively and elegant character. Described by some as the most purely refreshing beer in the world, only two traditional breweries still produce this style.

breweries.name: Long Trail Brewing Co
breweries.description: Long Trail Brewery is a microbrewery located in Bridgewater, Vermont, USA. It was opened in May of 1989 by Andy Pherson, who now serves both as the company's president and brewmaster. The company's first brewery was located in the basement of the Bridgewater Woolen Mill in Vermont's Green Mountains, but by 1995 the company had become popular enough that it was able to relocate to a state-of-the-art brewery and visitor center (featuring an open-air deck overlooking the Ottaquechee River) in Bridgewater Corners, VT.

breweries.name: Arizona Wilderness Brewing Company
breweries.description:
For years we've dreamed of bringing together our two loves: The beautiful and diverse state of Arizona together with hand crafted, artisanal ales. While backpacking the wondrous depths of Arizona we forged ideas that would one day become Arizona Wilderness Brewing Co. Well, here we are! We will continue our endeavor into the remote beauties of both the Arizona Wilderness and Craft Beer.

Our belief is that beer is more than a beverage to guzzle on Sundays, just another beverage at the party, or cheap yellow fizzy stuff dad drank while wearing his dirty flannel shirts. Beer is culture and we have a true PASSION for this amazing beverage! Check out our food menu, as it was created to pair quite nicely with our fine ales. C’mon in and see what we are up to next!

data.name: Beatnik Sour
data.description: Tart and acidic, Beatnik Sour is everything your conventional beer isn't. Unfiltered and extra pale with a pure white crown, we kettle soured the wort with Lactobacillus, leaving a refreshing lactic tartness that puckers your palate. 5.6% ABV 2 IBUs

data.name: BeerGarten Tart
data.description: Leinenkugel’s® BeerGarten Tart starts out with a snap of tartness balanced by a subtle sweetness from pale malts. It’s our take on a Berliner Weisse, a classic German biergarten summer favorite. Brewed with American wheat, BeerGarten Tart’s light body and refreshing finish are perfect for warm summer days.

breweries.name: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s. 

The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.

data.name: Beerliner Weisse
data.description: Brewed in celebration of our 15 year anniversary and named after our mobile catering/party bus, Beerliner Weisse is a tart, German-style wheat ale. Its low alcohol level, light body and refreshing tartness makes it the perfect summer beer.

style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)
style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.

breweries.name: North by Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
breweries.description:
North by Northwest came into existence from an idea that I had many years ago – that great craft brewed beer and fabulous food could come together in a fun and interesting atmosphere.

I chose the name North by Northwest because I wanted to convey the image of the Northwest where many brew pubs and micro-breweries got their start. Once settling on the name,the architecture and the image flowed naturally. Stone and wood are combined with the high vaulted ceiling to create the feel of those great lodges in our Northwest National parks.We have urbanized it a bit with the steel structure and industrial designed light fixtures. The Brewery Tower is a prominent feature along with the NXNW grain silos. The one directly in front of the Brewery Tower is a functioning silo full of 25,000 lbs. of barley – the major component ofthe beer making process. All the beers at NXNW are brewed right on site inside the Tower.

breweries.name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.
Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.

data.name: Belltower
data.description: A traditional, tart german style wheat beer. A refreshing and crisp lemony tartness plays in balance with the bready undertones laid down by the ample use of malted wheat. Delicious on its own, and be on the lookout for fruited variants!

style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)

breweries.name: Raleigh Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Raleigh Brewing Company will house a 20 bbl brew system to produce 6 year-round beers, 2 seasonal beers, and various experimental beers. All of our beers will be available in our taproom, which is located at the brewery. The taproom will have dartboards, a comfy lounge, and a few TVs for those days when the game is on. 

Our beer will also be available to the public. Ask for it at your local watering hole! 

At Raleigh Brewing Company we intend to be a big part of the local Raleigh community. We plan to do that by staying as green as possible by reclaiming our water used to brew with, recycling, and conserving energy, donating money/beer/time to local charities, and opening up our space for local groups/organizations/events as much as possible. If there's anything you'd like to see us do, just shoot us an email! 

We look forward to opening our doors and serving you some hand-crafted beers, which will hopefully be at the very beginning of 2013! 

Cheers!

data.description: The spirit of old Berlin lives on in our tart, tangy and refreshing Berliner Weisse. Enjoy this light-bodied, effervescent and quenching sour ale on its own, or sweeten the deal with a ‘Schuss’ of traditional raspberry or woodruff syrup.

breweries.name: Vintage Brewing Co
breweries.description:
In 2002 Brittany, Trent & Mark Kraemer opened Vintage Spirits & Grill on the corner of University & Frances near the UW-Madison campus.

In 2009, they, along with Bryan & Scott Manning and Mike Bridges decided to expand their family business and took over the vacant space formerly occupied by JT Whitneys.

They brought in a creative culinary team and set about creating a restaurant and brewery that features both excellent made-from-scratch food, and outstanding hand crafted beers.

"At Vintage Brewing Company, we're dedicated to bringing you world-class beer: fresh, flavorful, varied, & distinctive. We champion the craft of beer brewing as a harmony of art and science, where hard work and precision are guided by vision and passion. Cheers to great beer!"

breweries.name: Devils Backbone Brewing Company
breweries.description: 2012 GREAT AMERICAN BEER FESTIVAL SMALL BREWPUB and SMALL BREWPUB BREWER OF THE YEAR & 2010 WORLD BEER CUP CHAMPION BREWERY & SMALL BREWPUB, the award winning Basecamp Brewpub is situated in the majestic valley of the Blue Ridge Mountains with a lodge style atmosphere. We brew authentic craft beer in our brewhouse with a traditional German style brewing system and pour fresh brews daily from 16 taps in the pub area. Our menu specializes in oak wood -fired smoked dishes and local fare. We offer children their own special menu too!  Basecamp is open daily: 11:30pm serving lunch & dinner.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

style.name: Berliner-Style Weisse (Wheat)
style.description: This is very pale in color and the lightest of all the German wheat beers. The unique combination of yeast and lactic acid bacteria fermentation yields a beer that is acidic, highly attenuated, and very light bodied. The carbonation of a Berliner Weisse is high, and hop rates are very low. Clarity may be hazy or cloudy from yeast or chill haze. Hop character should not be perceived. Fruity esters will be evident. No diacetyl should be perceived.
